00048 #import <sys/socket.h>
00049 #import <netinet/in.h>
00050 #import <netinet6/in6.h>
00051 #import <arpa/inet.h>
00052 #import <ifaddrs.h>

00055 #import "Reachability.h"
00056 #import <SystemConfiguration/SCNetworkReachability.h>

00058 static NSString *kLinkLocalAddressKey = @"169.254.0.0";
00059 static NSString *kDefaultRouteKey = @"0.0.0.0";
00060 
00061 static Reachability *_sharedReachability;
00062 
00063 // A class extension that declares internal methods for this class.
00064 @interface Reachability()
00065 - (BOOL)isAdHocWiFiNetworkAvailableFlags:(SCNetworkReachabilityFlags *)outFlags;
00066 - (BOOL)isNetworkAvailableFlags:(SCNetworkReachabilityFlags *)outFlags;
00067 - (BOOL)isReachableWithoutRequiringConnection:(SCNetworkReachabilityFlags)flags;
00068 - (SCNetworkReachabilityRef)reachabilityRefForHostName:(NSString *)hostName;
00069 - (SCNetworkReachabilityRef)reachabilityRefForAddress:(NSString *)address;
00070 - (BOOL)addressFromString:(NSString *)IPAddress address:(struct sockaddr_in *)outAddress;
00071 - (void)stopListeningForReachabilityChanges;
00072 @end
00073 
00074 @implementation Reachability
00075 
00076 @synthesize networkStatusNotificationsEnabled = _networkStatusNotificationsEnabled;
00077 @synthesize hostName = _hostName;
00078 @synthesize address = _address;
00079 @synthesize reachabilityQueries = _reachabilityQueries;
00080 
00081 + (Reachability *)sharedReachability
00082 {
00083         if (!_sharedReachability) {
00084                 _sharedReachability = [[Reachability alloc] init];
00085                 // Clients of Reachability will typically call [[Reachability sharedReachability] setHostName:]
00086                 // before calling one of the status methods.
00087         _sharedReachability.hostName = nil;
00088                 _sharedReachability.address = nil;
00089                 _sharedReachability.networkStatusNotificationsEnabled = NO;
00090                 _sharedReachability.reachabilityQueries = [[NSMutableDictionary alloc] init];
00091         }
00092         return _sharedReachability;
00093 }
00094 
00095 - (void) dealloc
00096 {       
00097     [self stopListeningForReachabilityChanges];
00098     
00099         [_sharedReachability.reachabilityQueries release];
00100         [_sharedReachability release];
00101         [super dealloc];
00102 }
00103 
00104 - (BOOL)isReachableWithoutRequiringConnection:(SCNetworkReachabilityFlags)flags
00105 {
00106     // kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsReachable indicates that the specified nodename or address can
00107         // be reached using the current network configuration.
00108         BOOL isReachable = flags & kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsReachable;
00109         
00110         // This flag indicates that the specified nodename or address can
00111         // be reached using the current network configuration, but a
00112         // connection must first be established.
00113         //
00114         // If the flag is false, we don't have a connection. But because CFNetwork
00115     // automatically attempts to bring up a WWAN connection, if the WWAN reachability
00116     // flag is present, a connection is not required.
00117         BOOL noConnectionRequired = !(flags & kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsConnectionRequired);
00118         if ((flags & kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsIsWWAN)) {
00119                 noConnectionRequired = YES;
00120         }
00121         
00122         return (isReachable && noConnectionRequired) ? YES : NO;
00123 }
00124 
00125 // Returns whether or not the current host name is reachable with the current network configuration.
00126 - (BOOL)isHostReachable:(NSString *)host
00127 {
00128     if (!host || ![host length]) {
00129         return NO;
00130     }
00131     
00132     SCNetworkReachabilityFlags          flags;
00133     SCNetworkReachabilityRef reachability =  SCNetworkReachabilityCreateWithName(NULL, [host UTF8String]);
00134         BOOL gotFlags = SCNetworkReachabilityGetFlags(reachability, &flags);
00135     
00136         CFRelease(reachability);
00137     
00138     if (!gotFlags) {
00139         return NO;
00140     }
00141     
00142         return [self isReachableWithoutRequiringConnection:flags];
00143 }
00144 
00145 // This returns YES if the address 169.254.0.0 is reachable without requiring a connection.
00146 - (BOOL)isAdHocWiFiNetworkAvailableFlags:(SCNetworkReachabilityFlags *)outFlags
00147 {               
00148     // Look in the cache of reachability queries for one that matches this query.
00149         ReachabilityQuery *query = [self.reachabilityQueries objectForKey:kLinkLocalAddressKey];
00150         SCNetworkReachabilityRef adHocWiFiNetworkReachability = query.reachabilityRef;
00151         
00152     // If a cached reachability query was not found, create one.
00153     if (!adHocWiFiNetworkReachability) {
00154         
00155         // Build a sockaddr_in that we can pass to the address reachability query.
00156         struct sockaddr_in sin;
00157         
00158         bzero(&sin, sizeof(sin));
00159         sin.sin_len = sizeof(sin);
00160         sin.sin_family = AF_INET;
00161         // IN_LINKLOCALNETNUM is defined in <netinet/in.h> as 169.254.0.0
00162         sin.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(IN_LINKLOCALNETNUM);
00163         
00164         adHocWiFiNetworkReachability = SCNetworkReachabilityCreateWithAddress(NULL, (struct sockaddr *)&sin);
00165                 
00166                 query = [[[ReachabilityQuery alloc] init] autorelease];
00167                 query.hostNameOrAddress = kLinkLocalAddressKey;
00168                 query.reachabilityRef = adHocWiFiNetworkReachability;
00169                 
00170         // Add the reachability query to the cache.
00171                 [self.reachabilityQueries setObject:query forKey:kLinkLocalAddressKey];
00172     }
00173         
00174         // If necessary, register for notifcations for the SCNetworkReachabilityRef on the current run loop.
00175         // If an existing SCNetworkReachabilityRef was found in the cache, we can reuse it and register
00176         // to receive notifications from it in the current run loop, which may be different than the run loop
00177         // that was previously used when registering the SCNetworkReachabilityRef for notifications.
00178     // -scheduleOnRunLoop: will schedule only if network status notifications are enabled in the Reachability instance.
00179     // By default, they are not enabled. 
00180         [query scheduleOnRunLoop:[NSRunLoop currentRunLoop]];
00181     
00182     SCNetworkReachabilityFlags addressReachabilityFlags;
00183     BOOL gotFlags = SCNetworkReachabilityGetFlags(adHocWiFiNetworkReachability, &addressReachabilityFlags);
00184     if (!gotFlags) {
00185         // There was an error getting the reachability flags.
00186         return NO;
00187     }
00188     
00189     // Callers of this method might want to use the reachability flags, so if an 'out' parameter
00190     // was passed in, assign the reachability flags to it.
00191     if (outFlags) {
00192         *outFlags = addressReachabilityFlags;
00193     }
00194     
00195     return [self isReachableWithoutRequiringConnection:addressReachabilityFlags];
00196 }
00197 
00198 // ReachabilityCallback is registered as the callback for network state changes in startListeningForReachabilityChanges.
00199 static void ReachabilityCallback(SCNetworkReachabilityRef target, SCNetworkReachabilityFlags flags, void *info)
00200 {
00201         NSAutoreleasePool *pool = [[NSAutoreleasePool alloc] init];
00202     
00203     // Post a notification to notify the client that the network reachability changed.
00204     [[NSNotificationCenter defaultCenter] postNotificationName:@"kNetworkReachabilityChangedNotification" object:nil];
00205         
00206         [pool release];
00207 }
00208 
00209 // Perform a reachability query for the address 0.0.0.0. If that address is reachable without
00210 // requiring a connection, a network interface is available. We'll have to do more work to
00211 // determine which network interface is available.
00212 - (BOOL)isNetworkAvailableFlags:(SCNetworkReachabilityFlags *)outFlags
00213 {
00214         ReachabilityQuery *query = [self.reachabilityQueries objectForKey:kDefaultRouteKey];
00215         SCNetworkReachabilityRef defaultRouteReachability = query.reachabilityRef;
00216         
00217     // If a cached reachability query was not found, create one.
00218     if (!defaultRouteReachability) {
00219         
00220         struct sockaddr_in zeroAddress;
00221         bzero(&zeroAddress, sizeof(zeroAddress));
00222         zeroAddress.sin_len = sizeof(zeroAddress);
00223         zeroAddress.sin_family = AF_INET;
00224         
00225         defaultRouteReachability = SCNetworkReachabilityCreateWithAddress(NULL, (struct sockaddr *)&zeroAddress);
00226                 
00227                 ReachabilityQuery *query = [[[ReachabilityQuery alloc] init] autorelease];
00228                 query.hostNameOrAddress = kDefaultRouteKey;
00229                 query.reachabilityRef = defaultRouteReachability;
00230                 
00231                 [self.reachabilityQueries setObject:query forKey:kDefaultRouteKey];
00232     }
00233         
00234         // If necessary, register for notifcations for the SCNetworkReachabilityRef on the current run loop.
00235         // If an existing SCNetworkReachabilityRef was found in the cache, we can reuse it and register
00236         // to receive notifications from it in the current run loop, which may be different than the run loop
00237         // that was previously used when registering the SCNetworkReachabilityRef for notifications. 
00238     // -scheduleOnRunLoop: will schedule only if network status notifications are enabled in the Reachability instance.
00239     // By default, they are not enabled. 
00240         [query scheduleOnRunLoop:[NSRunLoop currentRunLoop]];
00241         
00242         SCNetworkReachabilityFlags flags;
00243         BOOL gotFlags = SCNetworkReachabilityGetFlags(defaultRouteReachability, &flags);
00244         if (!gotFlags) {
00245         return NO;
00246     }
00247     
00248         BOOL isReachable = [self isReachableWithoutRequiringConnection:flags];
00249         
00250         // Callers of this method might want to use the reachability flags, so if an 'out' parameter
00251         // was passed in, assign the reachability flags to it.
00252         if (outFlags) {
00253                 *outFlags = flags;
00254         }
00255         
00256         return isReachable;
00257 }
00258 
00259 // Be a good citizen and unregister for network state changes when the application terminates.
00260 - (void)stopListeningForReachabilityChanges
00261 {
00262         // Walk through the cache that holds SCNetworkReachabilityRefs for reachability
00263         // queries to particular hosts or addresses.
00264         NSEnumerator *enumerator = [self.reachabilityQueries objectEnumerator];
00265         ReachabilityQuery *reachabilityQuery;
00266     
00267         while (reachabilityQuery = [enumerator nextObject]) {
00268                 
00269                 CFArrayRef runLoops = reachabilityQuery.runLoops;
00270                 NSUInteger runLoopCounter, maxRunLoops = CFArrayGetCount(runLoops);
00271         
00272                 for (runLoopCounter = 0; runLoopCounter < maxRunLoops; runLoopCounter++) {
00273                         CFRunLoopRef nextRunLoop = (CFRunLoopRef)CFArrayGetValueAtIndex(runLoops, runLoopCounter);
00274                         
00275                         SCNetworkReachabilityUnscheduleFromRunLoop(reachabilityQuery.reachabilityRef, nextRunLoop, kCFRunLoopDefaultMode);
00276                 }
00277         
00278         CFArrayRemoveAllValues(reachabilityQuery.runLoops);
00279         }
00280 }
00281 
00282 /*
00283  Create a SCNetworkReachabilityRef for hostName, which lets us determine if hostName
00284  is currently reachable, and lets us register to receive notifications when the 
00285  reachability of hostName changes.
00286  */
00287 - (SCNetworkReachabilityRef)reachabilityRefForHostName:(NSString *)hostName
00288 {
00289         if (!hostName || ![hostName length]) {
00290                 return NULL;
00291         }
00292         
00293         // Look in the cache for an existing SCNetworkReachabilityRef for hostName.
00294         ReachabilityQuery *cachedQuery = [self.reachabilityQueries objectForKey:hostName];
00295         SCNetworkReachabilityRef reachabilityRefForHostName = cachedQuery.reachabilityRef;
00296         
00297         if (reachabilityRefForHostName) {
00298                 return reachabilityRefForHostName;
00299         }
00300         
00301         // Didn't find an existing SCNetworkReachabilityRef for hostName, so create one ...
00302         reachabilityRefForHostName = SCNetworkReachabilityCreateWithName(kCFAllocatorDefault, [hostName UTF8String]);
00303     
00304     NSAssert1(reachabilityRefForHostName != NULL, @"Failed to create SCNetworkReachabilityRef for host: %@", hostName);
00305     
00306         ReachabilityQuery *query = [[[ReachabilityQuery alloc] init] autorelease];
00307         query.hostNameOrAddress = hostName;
00308         query.reachabilityRef = reachabilityRefForHostName;
00309         
00310     // If necessary, register for notifcations for the SCNetworkReachabilityRef on the current run loop.
00311     // If an existing SCNetworkReachabilityRef was found in the cache, we can reuse it and register
00312     // to receive notifications from it in the current run loop, which may be different than the run loop
00313     // that was previously used when registering the SCNetworkReachabilityRef for notifications.
00314     // -scheduleOnRunLoop: will schedule only if network status notifications are enabled in the Reachability instance.
00315     // By default, they are not enabled. 
00316     [query scheduleOnRunLoop:[NSRunLoop currentRunLoop]];
00317     
00318     // ... and add it to the cache.
00319     [self.reachabilityQueries setObject:query forKey:hostName];
00320     return reachabilityRefForHostName;
00321 }
00322 
00323 /*
00324  Create a SCNetworkReachabilityRef for the IP address in addressString, which lets us determine if 
00325  the address is currently reachable, and lets us register to receive notifications when the 
00326  reachability of the address changes.
00327  */
00328 - (SCNetworkReachabilityRef)reachabilityRefForAddress:(NSString *)addressString
00329 {
00330         if (!addressString || ![addressString length]) {
00331                 return NULL;
00332         }
00333         
00334         struct sockaddr_in address;
00335         
00336         BOOL gotAddress = [self addressFromString:addressString address:&address];
00337         if (!gotAddress) {
00338         // The attempt to convert addressString to a sockaddr_in failed.
00339         NSAssert1(gotAddress != NO, @"Failed to convert an IP address string to a sockaddr_in: %@", addressString);
00340                 return NULL;
00341         }
00342         
00343         // Look in the cache for an existing SCNetworkReachabilityRef for addressString.
00344         ReachabilityQuery *cachedQuery = [self.reachabilityQueries objectForKey:addressString];
00345         SCNetworkReachabilityRef reachabilityRefForAddress = cachedQuery.reachabilityRef;
00346         
00347         if (reachabilityRefForAddress) {
00348                 return reachabilityRefForAddress;
00349         }
00350         
00351         // Didn't find an existing SCNetworkReachabilityRef for addressString, so create one.
00352         reachabilityRefForAddress = SCNetworkReachabilityCreateWithAddress(kCFAllocatorDefault, (struct sockaddr *)&address);
00353     
00354     NSAssert1(reachabilityRefForAddress != NULL, @"Failed to create SCNetworkReachabilityRef for address: %@", addressString);
00355     
00356         ReachabilityQuery *query = [[[ReachabilityQuery alloc] init] autorelease];
00357         query.hostNameOrAddress = addressString;
00358         query.reachabilityRef = reachabilityRefForAddress;
00359     
00360     // If necessary, register for notifcations for the SCNetworkReachabilityRef on the current run loop.
00361     // If an existing SCNetworkReachabilityRef was found in the cache, we can reuse it and register
00362     // to receive notifications from it in the current run loop, which may be different than the run loop
00363     // that was previously used when registering the SCNetworkReachabilityRef for notifications.
00364     // -scheduleOnRunLoop: will schedule only if network status notifications are enabled in the Reachability instance.
00365     // By default, they are not enabled. 
00366     [query scheduleOnRunLoop:[NSRunLoop currentRunLoop]];
00367     
00368     // ... and add it to the cache.
00369     [self.reachabilityQueries setObject:query forKey:addressString];
00370     return reachabilityRefForAddress;
00371 }
00372 
00373 - (NetworkStatus)remoteHostStatus
00374 {
00375         /*
00376      If the current host name or address is reachable, determine which network interface it is reachable through.
00377      If the host is reachable and the reachability flags include kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsIsWWAN, it
00378      is reachable through the carrier data network. If the host is reachable and the reachability
00379      flags do not include kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsIsWWAN, it is reachable through the WiFi network.
00380      */
00381     
00382         SCNetworkReachabilityRef reachabilityRef = nil;
00383         if (self.hostName) {
00384                 reachabilityRef = [self reachabilityRefForHostName:self.hostName];
00385                 
00386         } else if (self.address) {
00387                 reachabilityRef = [self reachabilityRefForAddress:self.address];
00388                 
00389         } else {
00390                 NSAssert(self.hostName != nil && self.address != nil, @"No hostName or address specified. Cannot determine reachability.");
00391                 return NotReachable;
00392         }
00393         
00394         if (!reachabilityRef) {
00395                 return NotReachable;
00396         }
00397         
00398         SCNetworkReachabilityFlags reachabilityFlags;
00399         BOOL gotFlags = SCNetworkReachabilityGetFlags(reachabilityRef, &reachabilityFlags);
00400     if (!gotFlags) {
00401         return NotReachable;
00402     }
00403     
00404         BOOL reachable = [self isReachableWithoutRequiringConnection:reachabilityFlags];
00405         
00406         if (!reachable) {
00407                 return NotReachable;
00408         }
00409         if (reachabilityFlags & ReachableViaCarrierDataNetwork) {
00410                 return ReachableViaCarrierDataNetwork;
00411         }
00412         
00413         return ReachableViaWiFiNetwork;
00414 }
00415 
00416 - (NetworkStatus)internetConnectionStatus
00417 {
00418         /*
00419      To determine if the device has an Internet connection, query the address
00420      0.0.0.0. If it's reachable without requiring a connection, first check
00421      for the kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsIsDirect flag, which tell us if the connection
00422      is to an ad-hoc WiFi network. If it is not, the device can access the Internet.
00423      The next thing to determine is how the device can access the Internet, which
00424      can either be through the carrier data network (EDGE or other service) or through
00425      a WiFi connection.
00426      
00427      Note: Knowing that the device has an Internet connection is not the same as
00428      knowing if the device can reach a particular host. To know that, use
00429      -[Reachability remoteHostStatus].
00430      */
00431         
00432         SCNetworkReachabilityFlags defaultRouteFlags;
00433         BOOL defaultRouteIsAvailable = [self isNetworkAvailableFlags:&defaultRouteFlags];
00434         if (defaultRouteIsAvailable) {
00435         
00436                 if (defaultRouteFlags & kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsIsDirect) {
00437             
00438                         // The connection is to an ad-hoc WiFi network, so Internet access is not available.
00439                         return NotReachable;
00440                 }
00441                 else if (defaultRouteFlags & ReachableViaCarrierDataNetwork) {
00442                         return ReachableViaCarrierDataNetwork;
00443                 }
00444                 
00445                 return ReachableViaWiFiNetwork;
00446         }
00447         
00448         return NotReachable;
00449 }
00450 
00451 - (NetworkStatus)localWiFiConnectionStatus
00452 {
00453         SCNetworkReachabilityFlags selfAssignedAddressFlags;
00454         
00455         /*
00456      To determine if the WiFi connection is to a local ad-hoc network,
00457      check the availability of the address 169.254.x.x. That's an address
00458      in the self-assigned range, and the device will have a self-assigned IP
00459      when it's connected to a ad-hoc WiFi network. So to test if the device
00460      has a self-assigned IP, look for the kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsIsDirect flag
00461      in the address query. If it's present, we know that the WiFi connection
00462      is to an ad-hoc network.
00463      */
00464         // This returns YES if the address 169.254.0.0 is reachable without requiring a connection.
00465         BOOL hasLinkLocalNetworkAccess = [self isAdHocWiFiNetworkAvailableFlags:&selfAssignedAddressFlags];
00466     
00467         if (hasLinkLocalNetworkAccess && (selfAssignedAddressFlags & kSCNetworkReachabilityFlagsIsDirect)) {
00468                 return ReachableViaWiFiNetwork;
00469         }
00470         
00471         return NotReachable;
00472 }
00473 
00474 // Convert an IP address from an NSString to a sockaddr_in * that can be used to create
00475 // the reachability request.
00476 - (BOOL)addressFromString:(NSString *)IPAddress address:(struct sockaddr_in *)address
00477 {
00478         if (!IPAddress || ![IPAddress length]) {
00479                 return NO;
00480         }
00481         
00482         memset((char *) address, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in), 0);
00483         address->sin_family = AF_INET;
00484         address->sin_len = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
00485         
00486         int conversionResult = inet_aton([IPAddress UTF8String], &address->sin_addr);
00487         if (conversionResult == 0) {
00488                 NSAssert1(conversionResult != 1, @"Failed to convert the IP address string into a sockaddr_in: %@", IPAddress);
00489                 return NO;
00490         }
00491         
00492         return YES;
00493 }
00494 
00495 @end
00496 
00497 @interface ReachabilityQuery ()
00498 - (CFRunLoopRef)startListeningForReachabilityChanges:(SCNetworkReachabilityRef)reachability onRunLoop:(CFRunLoopRef)runLoop;
00499 @end
00500 
00501 @implementation ReachabilityQuery
00502 
00503 @synthesize reachabilityRef = _reachabilityRef;
00504 @synthesize runLoops = _runLoops;
00505 @synthesize hostNameOrAddress = _hostNameOrAddress;
00506 
00507 - (id)init
00508 {
00509         self = [super init];
00510         if (self != nil) {
00511                 self.runLoops = CFArrayCreateMutable(kCFAllocatorDefault, 0, NULL);
00512         }
00513         return self;
00514 }
00515 
00516 - (void)dealloc
00517 {
00518         CFRelease(self.runLoops);
00519         [super dealloc];
00520 }
00521 
00522 - (BOOL)isScheduledOnRunLoop:(CFRunLoopRef)runLoop
00523 {
00524         NSUInteger runLoopCounter, maxRunLoops = CFArrayGetCount(self.runLoops);
00525         
00526         for (runLoopCounter = 0; runLoopCounter < maxRunLoops; runLoopCounter++) {
00527                 CFRunLoopRef nextRunLoop = (CFRunLoopRef)CFArrayGetValueAtIndex(self.runLoops, runLoopCounter);
00528                 
00529                 if (nextRunLoop == runLoop) {
00530                         return YES;
00531                 }
00532         }
00533         
00534         return NO;
00535 }
00536 
00537 - (void)scheduleOnRunLoop:(NSRunLoop *)inRunLoop
00538 {
00539         // Only register for network state changes if the client has specifically enabled them.
00540         if ([[Reachability sharedReachability] networkStatusNotificationsEnabled] == NO) {
00541                 return;
00542         }
00543         
00544         if (!inRunLoop) {
00545                 return;
00546         }
00547         
00548         CFRunLoopRef runLoop = [inRunLoop getCFRunLoop];
00549         
00550         // Notifications of status changes for each reachability query can be scheduled on multiple run loops.
00551         // To support that, register for notifications for each runLoop.
00552         // -isScheduledOnRunLoop: iterates over all of the run loops that have previously been used
00553         // to register for notifications. If one is found that matches the passed in runLoop argument, there's
00554         // no need to register for notifications again. If one is not found, register for notifications
00555         // using the current runLoop.
00556         if (![self isScheduledOnRunLoop:runLoop]) {
00557         
00558                 CFRunLoopRef notificationRunLoop = [self startListeningForReachabilityChanges:self.reachabilityRef onRunLoop:runLoop];
00559                 if (notificationRunLoop) {
00560                         CFArrayAppendValue(self.runLoops, notificationRunLoop);
00561                 }
00562         }
00563 }
00564 
00565 // Register to receive changes to the 'reachability' query so that we can update the
00566 // user interface when the network state changes.
00567 - (CFRunLoopRef)startListeningForReachabilityChanges:(SCNetworkReachabilityRef)reachability onRunLoop:(CFRunLoopRef)runLoop
00568 {       
00569         if (!reachability) {
00570                 return NULL;
00571         }
00572         
00573         if (!runLoop) {
00574                 return NULL;
00575         }
00576     
00577         SCNetworkReachabilityContext    context = {0, self, NULL, NULL, NULL};
00578         SCNetworkReachabilitySetCallback(reachability, ReachabilityCallback, &context);
00579         SCNetworkReachabilityScheduleWithRunLoop(reachability, runLoop, kCFRunLoopDefaultMode);
00580         
00581         return runLoop;
00582 }
00583 
00584 
00585 @end
